Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) is considered to be a highly efficient device to convert chemical fuels directly into electrical power.
Titulo: Effect of continuously graded functional layer on curvature and residual stress of solid oxide fuel cell in initial reduction process

Sentencas: Because of multilayer composite arrangement of cells, mismatch of the thermal expansion coefficients, chemical/thermal gradient, or phase change of the materials will result in residual stresses, which are reflected in the pronounced bending of unconstrained cells and cause a reliable problem.
Titulo: Effect of continuously graded functional layer on curvature and residual stress of solid oxide fuel cell in initial reduction process

Sentencas: Considerable efforts have been devoted to the analysis of residual stresses in an elastic multilayer system, and one of the efforts that are to improve not only electrochemical performance for high energy conversion efficiency but also long term stability, is to process a continuously gradient anode functional layer (CG-AFL) between dense electrolyte and porous anode.
Titulo: Effect of continuously graded functional layer on curvature and residual stress of solid oxide fuel cell in initial reduction process

Sentencas: Hence to understand the stress distribution and deformation of the multilayer with a CG-AFL is needed for the cell design.
Titulo: Effect of continuously graded functional layer on curvature and residual stress of solid oxide fuel cell in initial reduction process

Sentencas: As the chemical reduction takes place at the interface between NiO-YSZ and the previously reduced porous Ni-YSZ, a reduced layer, together with the unreduced layer and the electrolyte will cause the residual stresses to be re-distributed.
Titulo: Effect of continuously graded functional layer on curvature and residual stress of solid oxide fuel cell in initial reduction process

Sentencas: In this paper, taking the CG-AFL into account, the curvature and residual stresses of half-cell during reduction are analyzed.
Titulo: Effect of continuously graded functional layer on curvature and residual stress of solid oxide fuel cell in initial reduction process

Sentencas: The results show that the curvature of half-cell with a CG-AFL increases as the reduction process.
Titulo: Effect of continuously graded functional layer on curvature and residual stress of solid oxide fuel cell in initial reduction process

Sentencas: And the curvature would also increase as the thickness of the CG-AFL increases, and decrease with the increase of the index of power function that expresses young's modulus and thermal expansion coefficient of gradient layer.
Titulo: Effect of continuously graded functional layer on curvature and residual stress of solid oxide fuel cell in initial reduction process

Sentencas: The residual stresses among the layers are correspondingly influenced by the thickness of the gradient layer, the index of power function and reduction extent.
Titulo: Effect of continuously graded functional layer on curvature and residual stress of solid oxide fuel cell in initial reduction process

Sentencas: When taking power function as a linear function, the gradient layer obviously reduces the residual stress in the electrolyte.
Titulo: Effect of continuously graded functional layer on curvature and residual stress of solid oxide fuel cell in initial reduction process

Sentencas: However, the increase of the index in power function will cause the increase of electrolyte residual stress.
Titulo: Effect of continuously graded functional layer on curvature and residual stress of solid oxide fuel cell in initial reduction process

Sentencas: These mentioned analyses reveal that the CG-AFL cannot offer a solution that simultaneously improves the residual stress and curvature in a half-cell in terms of thickness and profile exponent of CG-AFL, i.e., the mitigation of residual stress will give rise to the increase of curvature, and vice versa.
Titulo: Effect of continuously graded functional layer on curvature and residual stress of solid oxide fuel cell in initial reduction process

Sentencas: On the other hand, for part-reduced half-cell, the maximum tensile stress is found at anode/gradient layer interface in anode layer, which may facilitate structural failure since tensile residual stress is so high that it reaches the fracture strength of anode material.
Titulo: Effect of continuously graded functional layer on curvature and residual stress of solid oxide fuel cell in initial reduction process

Sentencas: Consequently, it is important to ensure that the anode is fully reduced in practice.
Titulo: Effect of continuously graded functional layer on curvature and residual stress of solid oxide fuel cell in initial reduction process

Sentencas: In conclusion, the existing gradient layer is helpful for enhancing the cell reliability via suitable design.
Titulo: Effect of continuously graded functional layer on curvature and residual stress of solid oxide fuel cell in initial reduction process
